author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Madras High Court Bench here on Tuesday gave three more months’ time to the Crime Branch Criminal Investigation Department to crack the murder case of former Transport Minister K.N. Nehru’s brother K.N. Ramajeyam.

Justice V.S. Ravi gave time till June 1 after accepting the submissions of Additional Advocate General K. Chellapandian that the investigation was proceeding in the right direction and the investigating officer was confident of achieving a breakthrough at the earliest.

Mr. Ramajeyam, a prominent businessman in Tiruchi, was apparently abducted during his morning walk near his residence in Thillai Nagar and murdered brutally by unidentified assailants on March 29, 2012.

His wife Latha approached the High Court Bench in December 2014 seeking a CBI probe since the CB-CID failed to arrest the culprits even after two years.

Since then, the High Court had been providing time, once in three months, to the CB-CID.
title: CB-CID gets more time in Ramajeyam case
